events.description: The release of Colombia's annual and monthly inflation data for January 2026, showing an acceleration in price growth.

facts.fact_text: Colombia's annual inflation rate rose to 5.35% in January 2026 from 5.10% in December.

evidences.evidence_text: Colombia’s annual inflation rate rose to 5.35% in January 2026 from 5.10% in December.

facts.fact_text: The Colombian central bank has an inflation target of 3%.

evidences.evidence_text: price growth remaining well above the central bank’s 3% target.

facts.fact_text: Consumer prices rose 1.18% on a monthly basis in January.

evidences.evidence_text: On a monthly basis, consumer prices rose 1.18% in January, sharply accelerating from a 0.27% increase in December.

claims.claim_text: Inflation accelerated notably in food, non-alcoholic beverages, and furnishings.

evidences.evidence_text: Inflation accelerated notably in food and non-alcoholic beverages (5.11% vs. 5.07%), housing (4.59% vs. 4.76%), and furnishings (4.12% vs. 3.31%).

claims.claim_text: Price pressures eased in healthcare, clothing, recreation, and transport sectors.

evidences.evidence_text: In contrast, price pressures eased in healthcare (7.38% vs. 7.20%), clothing (2.45% vs. 2.12%), recreation and culture (2.54% vs. 1.85%), and transport (5.79% vs. 5.35%).

evidence.evidence_text: Colombia’s annual inflation rate rose to 5.35% in January 2026 from 5.10% in December.
Inflation accelerated notably in food and non-alcoholic beverages (5.11% vs. 5.07%)
On a monthly basis, consumer prices rose 1.18% in January, sharply accelerating from a 0.27% increase in December.
